items.title: Cameroon's Biya vies for eighth term, former spokesperson challenging him
items.summary: YAOUNDE (Reuters) -Cameroonian President Paul Biya is running for an eighth term on Sunday that could keep him in office until he is nearly 100, seeking to overcome frustration with his decades-long rule and a spirited challenge from a former government mouthpiece. Read full story

items.title: Amazon SanDisk storage sale now live with up to 42% off! Memory cards, SSDs, flash drives, more from just $19
items.summary:
As part of the ongoing Prime Big Deal Days sale, we are now tracking a handful of solid deals on SanDisk storage devices, including microSD cards, SSDs, flash drives, and more at Amazon. You can save up to 42% today by cashing in on the brand’s storage device deals, and the prices for these are starting at just $19. Everything from SSDs and flash drives from the brand’s Creator Pro series to memory cards, game drives, and more are discounted as part of the sale right now. Normally these two go for $109 and $169 at full price, respectively, with the latter having seen recurring discounts to the same rate over the year and the former dropping lower than ever. You can take advantage of the $34 and $70 markdowns while the Prime Day savings last to score either (or both) of these models at the best prices of the year.

It would normally cost you $800 without any savings, but we’re seeing it get the largest of the brand’s discounts during this event, which drops it $20 lower than any price we have tracked to date.
